steps.title: Make sure the firearm is unloaded, and the magazine is removed.
steps.content: Make sure the firearm is unloaded, and the magazine is removed. Pull back the charging handle to eject any loaded rounds. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Remove the cleaning rod located at the front of the rifle below the barrel.
steps.content: Remove the cleaning rod located at the front of the rifle below the barrel. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Remove the bolt cover by pressing the button on the back of the bolt cover forward.
steps.content: Remove the bolt cover by pressing the button on the back of the bolt cover forward. This may take a little jiggling, but mostly just use a constant pressure pulling the cover up and back (toward the comb and up). [3] X Research source

steps.title: Remove the bolt spring.
steps.content: Remove the bolt spring. Press the same button toward the front of the gun, sliding it out of its channel. Remove by pulling it backward. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Pull out the bolt and charging handle.
steps.content: Pull out the bolt and charging handle. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Use the cleaning kit tool to unlock the gas tube (the lever on the side of your rear sight).
steps.content: Use the cleaning kit tool to unlock the gas tube (the lever on the side of your rear sight). The lever should be pointing at a right angle to the barrel. [6] X Research source

steps.title: At this point, you may clean your firearm with various solvents or oils.
steps.content: At this point, you may clean your firearm with various solvents or oils. In my experience, Hoppe's gun oil is one of the best.

steps.title: Perform these steps in reverse order to re-assemble your firearm.
steps.content: Perform these steps in reverse order to re-assemble your firearm. If you get stuck, find an online forum to assist you.
